sub_topic: Investigation of the piezoelectric effect in a crystal
message_1: What is the piezoelectric coefficient of a quartz crystal when a compressive force of 10 N is applied?
message_2:
To determine the piezoelectric coefficient (d) of a quartz crystal, we need to know the generated electric charge (Q) and the applied force (F). The piezoelectric coefficient is given by the formula:

d = Q / F

However, you only provided the compressive force (F = 10 N) applied to the quartz crystal. To calculate the piezoelectric coefficient, we need to know the generated electric charge (Q) as well. 

If you provide the generated electric charge, I can help you calculate the piezoelectric coefficient.
